channel.title: The New Yorker — Reporting
channel.description: Latest reporting from The New Yorker

item.title: One of the Greatest Polar-Bear Hunters Confronts a Vanishing World
item.description: In the most remote settlement in Greenland, Hjelmer Hammeken’s life style has gone from something that worked for thousands of years to something that may not outlive him.

item.title: Disappeared to a Foreign Prison
item.description: The Trump Administration is deporting people to countries they have no ties to, where many are being detained indefinitely or forcibly returned to the places they fled.

item.title: How the Sports Stadium Went Luxe
item.description: Is the race to create ever more lavish spectator offerings in America’s largest entertainment venues changing the fan experience?

item.title: A Very Big Fight Over a Very Small Language
item.description: In the Swiss Alps, a plan to tidy up Romansh—spoken by less than one per cent of the country—set off a decades-long quarrel over identity, belonging, and the sound of authenticity.

item.title: In the Line of Fire
item.description: During the Trump era, political violence has become an increasingly urgent problem. Elected officials from both parties are struggling to respond.

item.title: Katy Waldman on Mary McCarthy’s “One Touch of Nature”
item.description: A reader trusts the author’s voice instinctively, charmed by its opaline assessments and zinging aperçus. Still, one can quibble.

item.title: Oliver Sacks Put Himself Into His Case Studies. What Was the Cost?
item.description: The scientist was famous for linking healing with storytelling. Sometimes that meant reshaping patients’ reality.

item.title: And Your Little Dog, Too
item.description: Two small dogs, both unleashed, rushed toward me, snarling, and one of them bit me on my left leg, just below the knee. It all happened within a second.

item.title: How to Leave the U.S.A.
item.description: In the wake of President Trump’s reëlection, the number of aggrieved Americans seeking a new life abroad appears to be rising. The Netherlands offers one way out.

item.title: The Mischievous Ex-Bankers Behind “Industry”
item.description: Konrad Kay and Mickey Down failed as financiers—but they’re making a killing by depicting the profession on HBO.
